title: US election: The women who hold the key to Trump's survival
description: Suburban women are a key voting bloc this election - but can Trump still count on their support?

title: US election 2020: The 750,000 people you didn’t know could vote
description: Hundreds of thousands of people in US jails are entitled to vote in 2020 - but most have no idea.

title: The Countdown: Kellyanne Conway, Miles Taylor and the speculation game
description: The latest election drama, and what speculation about who wrote the book Anonymous really tells us.

title: France lockdown: 'It's hard to think we're once again stuck at home'
description: Students in France and Germany tell Radio 1 Newsbeat what it's like going back into a national lockdown.

title: Covid: Sir Rocco Forte's claims fact-checked
description: The hotelier says the government "overreacted" and "panicked" in its response to the pandemic.

title: Coronavirus doctor's diary: 'Our hospital could soon be overwhelmed'
description: Dr John Wright and two consultants describe the immense pressure Bradford Royal Infirmary is coming under.

title: Family 'desperate' over missing Team GB runner Chris Smith
description: Team GB mountain runner Chris Smith has been missing since going for a run in Perthshire on Tuesday morning.

title: Duchess of Sussex: Privacy trial against Mail on Sunday postponed
description: Meghan is suing Associated Newspapers over the publication of a letter she wrote to her father.

title: France attack: Deadly stabbing in Nice 'is terrorism', says mayor
description: The mayor of Nice says a suspect has been arrested after the attack at the Notre-Dame basilica.

title: Covid-19: Nearly 100,000 catching virus every day - study
description: England is at a "critical stage" with infections doubling every nine days, a major analysis estimates.

title: Wishaw mother who left dying daughter to visit pub is jailed
description: Sharon Goldie subjected her 13-year-old daughter Robyn to a year of neglect and abuse before she died.

title: Bobby Ball: Cannon & Ball star dies aged 76 after Covid-19 diagnosis
description: The star was one half of comedy duo Cannon & Ball and appeared in Last of the Summer Wine.

title: Hornby: Model train maker steams ahead in lockdown
description: The company says sales are up 33% as more people take up hobbies during the pandemic.

title: Labour broke equalities law over anti-Semitism
description: The party's current leader, Sir Keir Starmer, said it was "a day of shame" for Labour.

title: England's Hill to make debut against Italy in Six Nations finale
description: Exeter's double-winning lock Jonny Hill will make his England debut in Saturday's Six Nations match against Italy in Rome.

title: NHS Covid-19 app to issue more self-isolate alerts
description: Officials have decided to lower the threshold at which stay-at-home notifications are served to users.

title: BBC issues new guidance for social media usage
description: Staff will not be allowed to express a personal opinion on politics or other controversial subjects.

title: Lundstram rejects new Sheff Utd contract
description: Sheffield United manager Chris Wilder says it is "frustrating" as midfielder John Lundstram turns down a new contract offer.

title: Lewis-Hughes to make Wales debut against Scotland
description: Cardiff Blues flanker Shane Lewis-Hughes will make his Wales debut against Scotland in Saturday's delayed Six Nations finale.

title: A guide to Labour Party anti-Semitism claims
description: The roots of the row that continues to overshadow the Labour Party.

title: David Jason: They thought I'd be Grandad, not Del Boy
description: The Only Fools and Horses star looks back on his career in TV – and other high-flying exploits.

title: Why does a political battle loom over planning rules?
description: A planned overhaul of England's house building rules has drawn criticism across political divides.

title: JJ Williams: Legendary Wales and British and Irish Lions wing dies
description: Legendary Wales, British and Irish Lions and Llanelli wing JJ Williams dies at the age of 72.

title: Ireland's Women's Six Nations game off because of Covid-19 outbreak in France camp
description: Ireland's final Women's Six Nations game against France is called off after a Covid-19 outbreak in the French camp.

title: MOTDx: Rap Game UK's Krept and Konan rate footballers' rap skills
description: Krept and Konan, UK rappers and judges on BBC Three's Rap Game UK, rate the mic skills of professional footballers including Romelu Lukaku, Paul Pogba and Yannick Bolasie on MOTDx.

title: Light pollution's wasted energy seen from space
description: Entire city dims its streetlights, enabling scientists to measure light pollution from space.

title: 'Hard work, sacrifice and difficult conversations' - how I became a football broadcaster
description: BBC Sport's Tom Gayle speaks to Mark Scott, Anne-Marie Batson and Seb Hutchinson about their journeys into football broadcasting.

title: School tours turn virtual ahead of application deadline
description: With the pandemic limiting open days, schools are turning to promotional videos to attract students.

title: The Papers: 'Change of strategy looms' as France locks down
description: The front pages say the UK is under pressure to go back into lockdown, while France faces new restrictions.

title: US election: 'Our kids died in the Parkland shooting, but we disagree on guns'
description: The parents of two Parkland victims share different views on the issue of gun violence in the US.

title: How do 'Blue Wall' voters rate the Tories one year on?
description: People in Great Grimsby and Redcar reflect on the government, one year after 2019's general election was called.

title: Che Lingo: Meet the rapper signed by Idris Elba
description: One of the south Londoner's songs became a soundtrack for Black Lives Matter protests this summer.

title: Muttiah Muralitharan on the 'challenge' of his disputed biopic
description: A planned biopic of Sri Lanka bowler Muttiah Muralitharan has drawn protests but he insists it will air.

title: Cancer patient's leg treated in separate Glasgow hospital
description: Part of Janette Ritson's leg was removed and treated at a Glasgow hospital, while she was six miles away.

title: Marcus Rashford: Man Utd striker scores hat-trick after 1m signatures
description: Told to "stick to his football", Marcus Rashford scores a hat-trick for Manchester United in the Champions League thrashing of RB Leipzig.

title: Animal Crossing: 'My sister lives on in a video game'
description: Tending to her sister's virtual town in Animal Crossing helps Meredith Myers keep her memory alive and cope with her grief.

title: End Sars protests: 'I felt I was going to die there'
description: Ephraim, a British-Nigerian activist at the heart of the End Sars protests in Lagos, talks about what he saw.

title: Big House theatre group helping young care leavers
description: A theatre group is supporting young care leavers in the arts industry achieve their dreams.

title: US Election 2020: Will America's race issue decide the next president?
description: The BBC's Clive Myrie goes to the crucial state of Arizona, where black votes could decide who wins.

title: CEO Secrets: The aviation workers starting new businesses
description: We hear from three people who have started their own companies during the downturn in aviation.

title: 'Furlough pay should be kept at 80% of our salaries'
description: Workers facing new lockdowns: "We need furlough pay to be kept at 80% of our salaries."
